newsitem.title: INDIA: Delhi shares end higher on Chidambaram statement.
newsitem.headline: Delhi shares end higher on Chidambaram statement.

text.p: Delhi shares closed higher in hectic trade on Monday buoyed by Finance Minister P. Chidambaram's statement that a controversial tax on companies might be removed, brokers said.
The Delhi Stock Exchange's sensitive index closed 14.95 points, or 2.3 percent, higher at 661.75.
Chidambaram was quoted on Sunday as saying there might be reason for the minimum alternate tax (MAT) to "disappear" as both company law and the income tax act were being redrafted.
Industry has complained that the MAT has eroded some companies' profits.
"It seems that the government is considering overall measures to bring back buoyancy in the capital market and may announce measures to woo investors," said Anil Saigal of brokers A.K. Saigal.
ACC was in spotlight throughout the day and closed 85 rupees, or 8.4 percent, higher at 1,095 on heavy buying by foreign institutional investors (FIIs), brokers said.
Reliance Industries gained 5.10 rupees to 193.35 on mutual fund buying.
State Bank of India ended 8.90 rupees, or 4.3 percent, higher at 217.50 on heavy buying by FIIs coupled with short-covering by speculators.
TELCO surged 22.50 rupees to 335 on speculative buying.
Larsen and Toubro jumped 5.20 rupees to 212.45.
